steps.description: This tour introduces the `OffRamp` component. You will meet its three Solidity sources and see where the public entry-points live inside `OffRamp.sol` so you can distinguish the commit path, the execution path, and the admin & read-only helpers.
The core contract.  `OffRamp` inherits `MultiOCR3Base` (line 32) and packs the logic for committing `Merkle roots`, executing messages and administering per-chain lanes.
A slim extension of `OffRamp` (line 10).  It only stores a transformer address and overrides one virtual hook so external logic can mutate each message before execution.
**Shared OCR-3** plumbing: one `config` per `plugin` type, **signature-checked** `_transmit` (231-297) and a **fork-detection guard** (327-330).
Commit path – `commit()` is the public entry-point used by the **DON** to submit signed root & price reports.
Execution path (DON) – `execute()` decodes an execution report, runs `_batchExecute` and still forwards the bytes to `_transmit` with signature checking disabled.
**Execution path (manual)** – `manuallyExecute()` lets anyone retry messages with gas overrides while reusing the same `_batchExecute` helper.
**Admin** – `applySourceChainConfigUpdates()` lets the owner update per-source lane parameters.
Admin – `setDynamicConfig()` swaps `FeeQuoter` / `interceptor` settings that affect runtime behaviour.
**Getter** – `getExecutionState()` exposes the per-message bitmap so clients can see whether a sequence number is untouched, in-progress, failed or succeeded.
More getters – `static config`, `dynamic config`, and `per-source lane config` are all publicly readable.

You can now name the files and the top-level responsibilities of each:
- `OffRamp.sol` — commit reports, execute messages, owner admin, read-only views.
- `OffRampWithMessageTransformer` — thin wrapper that tweaks a message through a transformer before execution.
- `MultiOCR3Base` — generic OCR-3 framework providing config storage, signature verification and fork-safety.
